result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack D. Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence withheld:  DE placed on 3 years of probation, conditions: 6 months county jail, with Huber, with credit for 65 days.  Fine/costs $853.00.  Pay restitution of $1514.81 to Walmart plus applicable surcharges, which is joint and several with 2 other DE.  NO CONTACT with ALL Walmart locations.  80 hours community service.   DE to obtain GED.   Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.

miscConds.notes: $603.00 fine. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
